comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think this is Brooklyn, NSW. Railway mainline on the left, Dangar Island behind. See Google MapsStreetView - maps.google.co.uk/maps?q=Brooklyn,+NSW,+Australia&hl=...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The ferry on the right looks to me like the SS 'Phoenix'. Built 1899 for the NSW Public Works Department as a tug and staff ferry - later moved to the Hawkesbury as a ferry with altered superstructure. See comments and links here - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4349493897/] And also this image at Brooklyn c.1910 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823320&am...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I think you're right this looks like Brooklyn with Dangar Island behind, great work! Though I am not sure if that vessel is PHOENIX as the lettering on the top deck of the vessel is quite different, notice how there is lettering either side of the central lettering?
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 56512128@N06
comment._content: Hi Phoenix at: www.pittwateronlinenews.com/ss-phoenix-and-general-gordon... other vessel above is the Florrie; original mailboat; infor at: www.pittwateronlinenews.com/pittwater-ferries---ss-florri...
